page.title: 17HATCH COURT II
page.content: In the drawing room, there is a Japanese embroidered picture of peacocks on white silk. On the ceiling there is Rocco plaster work showing the Sun God in the centre. In the Orangery, there is a big, stuffed fish which is part of a collection of animal heads. On the floor you can see the marks of the plant pots in which oranges used to be grown. In the china room, there is lots of expensive china and some particularly fine green plates decorated with white birds. In the museum, there are many exhibits from different wars and some medals which are mainly connected with the Canadian Light Infantry.
